featured.text: Many folk tales are also tall tales—stories of unbelievable events told with perfect seriousness.
A man might once have fought a bear, for example, and the tales told about him might make him into the greatest bear fighter who ever lived.
A tall tale, in other words, is a story in which the truth has been exaggerated.
A culture’s folk tales, fables, songs, and proverbs are an important part of its literature.

other.text: what happens on Earth, and are responsible for quite a few legends, and that the ancient Greek and Roman gods, __(34)__ the fairies and dwarfs in many classical tales, were in fact “space people” living here.
According to this passage, folk tales _________.
Folk tales are usually the stories of _________.
Many folk tales originally had some basis in fact and grew out of the lives of real people.
Folk tales are both down-to-earth and highly imaginative.
Which of the following statements about tall tales is NOT TRUE? (A) Tall tales are factual stories.
By reading and listening to folk tales, we may gain a better understanding of the true values, beliefs, and goals of a people. 41.

definition.en_def: A narrative, often fictional, that tells a story.
definition.example: The old man told a fascinating tale about his adventures.
